paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

patients.demographics: patients with hypertrophic cardiomyopathy referred to tertiary centres

individual_records.evidence_sentence: recent studies showed that around 9.3% of 343 patients with HCM referred to tertiary centres have CA (5% ATTRwt, 3.5% ATTRv, and 0.9% AL)

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with a higher risk of developing cardiac amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical studies.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is particularly common in African Americans and Afro-Caribbeans.
key_quotes: The variant that is most commonly associated with ATTR-CA is ATTRV122I, which is the most common mutation identified in the USA, especially in the African Americans and Afro-Caribbeans.

patients.demographics: patients diagnosed with HCM in France

individual_records.evidence_sentence: 5% of 298 consecutive patients diagnosed with HCM in France had, in fact, ATTRv.

functional_data.summary: The variant is linked to a late-onset cardiac phenotype.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in families.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on clinical studies.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is associated with a better prognosis than ATTRV122I.
key_quotes: In contrast, the most commonly spread mutation worldwide is ATTRV30M especially in endemic regions like Portugal, Scandinavia, and Japan.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
